snippet: Flushing Meadows-Corona Park is a homely beauty and although it does not have the support from wealthy donors it is rich in love from its residents.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column questions why the Bloomberg administration does not give Flushing Meadows-Corona Park the same respect and attention given more prestigious New York City parks; holds that city officials are considering development efforts for the park, like a shopping mall on its edges and a professional soccer stadium at its very core, that ignore the park's role as a vital public space for the residents of a densely packed neighborhood.
lead_paragraph: Flushing Meadows-Corona Park is a homely beauty and although it does not have the support from wealthy donors it is rich in love from its residents.

headline.print_headline: In Queens, An Oasis Neglected By the City
headline.seo: In Queens, an Oasis Neglected by the City
headline.main: In Queens, an Oasis Neglected by the City
